III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4160 Emergency restraint.
Section (1) The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving response for a
Description youth will be limited to:
(a) An emergency response to protect the youth or others from
an unanticipated or severely aggressive behavior that places the
youth or others at serious threat of violence or injury if no
immediate intervention occurs.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/10/24 Youth A was observed with bruises and scratches on
his body as a result of being restrained by unknown staff
members.
Investigation This complaint was received on 01/10/2024 and assigned for joint
investigation with MDHHS Specialist.
Interviews:
I contacted complainant on 12/18/2023, no additional information
was provided.
I interviewed Director at the facility, on 01/12/2024, jointly with
MDHHS Specialist. Director reported on 01/09/2024 they had an
onsite event for the youths to receive presents. Youth A was
triggered because he didn’t like what he received, so when he
went back to the cottage he was escalated and hurt himself. Staff
1 and Staff 2 restrained Youth A because he was hurting himself.
Director said Staff 1 did a body chart after the restraint, there were
no injuries noted and Youth A denied being hurt or injured during
the restraint. Director said when Youth A gets triggered, Youth A
becomes aggressive and will hurt himself.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility, on 01/12/2024, jointly with the
MDHHS Specialist. Youth A reported he was restrained last week
but could not recall which staff restrained him. Youth A said two
staff members put his hands behind his back and restrained him.
Youth A said he has a bruise on his chest but that was from a fight
with Youth B. Youth A denied getting hurt from being restrained.
Youth A was extremely distracted, unfocused, and difficult to
interview.
I interviewed Youth B at the facility, on 01/12/2024, jointly with the
MDHHS Specialist. Youth B admitted he got into a fight with Youth
A. He said Youth A swung at him first and he then punched Youth
A in the chest. Youth B said Staff 3 was there and separated them
immediately. He said Youth A was upset because he didn’t like
2

the present he received. Youth B said later in the evening, Youth
A was still upset and was yelling and cussing at the staff. Youth B
admitted that he tried to kick Youth A when Staff 1 and Staff 2
were trying to restrain Youth A. Youth B said Staff 3 stopped him
and directed Youth B to go to his room.
I interviewed Staff 1 onsite on 01/12/2024, jointly with MDHHS
Specialist. Staff 1 is a shift leader, has been working at the agency
for 6 months, and is trained in Crisis Prevention and Intervention
(CPI). He reported on 01/09/2024 Youth A was upset because he
didn’t like the gifts he received, became aggressive and hurt
himself. Staff 1 said he and Staff 2 attempted to verbally de-
escalate Youth A, but Youth A continued to escalate and hurt
himself. Youth A was restrained to prevent him from hurting
himself. Youth A punched the wall, kicked the garbage can, and
hit his head against a metal box on the wall. Staff 1 and Staff 2 put
Youth A in a standing restraint for a few seconds, Youth A
dropped to the floor and Staff 1 and Staff 2 released Youth A.
Youth A sat on the floor for a few seconds, rocked back and forth,
and again began to kick and hit his head. He and Staff 2
attempted to help Youth A get off the floor, Youth A dropped to the
floor, kicked Staff 1 and Staff 1 attempted to block the kick and
pushed Youth A’s leg away. Staff 1 said at that point they backed
away and continued to use verbal de-escalation. A few minutes
later, Youth A stood up and went to his room. Staff 1 denied Youth
A getting hurt or injured as a result of the restraint.
I spoke with Youth A’s Foster Care Worker via telephone on
01/22/2024. She reported Youth A has been at the facility for
almost two years. Youth A is autistic and when escalated, he
becomes aggressive. In August of 2023, Youth A was evaluated
and diagnosed with Autism. Youth A requires more intensive
treatment for his diagnosis; therefore, she is working on finding a
new placement to address his needs and treatment. She said
Youth A denied getting hurt from the restraint.
I interviewed Staff 2 via telephone on 02/08/2024. Staff 2 recalled
the incident on 01/09/2024. Staff 2 said Youth A was triggered
because he didn’t get a sonic toy and became escalated and hit
his head against a metal box. He and Staff 1 initially attempted
verbal de-escalation, but when Youth A hit his head against the
metal box, Youth A was put in a standing restraint. Youth A was
only restrained for a few seconds because Youth A dropped to his
knees, so they released the restraint. Staff 1 said Youth A
continued to kick and hurt himself, so they attempted to get him off
3

the floor. Staff 2 attempted to block Youth A’s kicking and Staff 1
grabbed Youth A’s foot and pushed it away. Staff 2 said he and
Staff 1 moved away from Youth A and continued to use verbal de-
escalation to avoid Youth A becoming more aggressive. Youth A
eventually calmed down without any other interventions. He
denied Youth A was hurt or injured as a result of the restraint.
On 02/08/2024 a predisposition conference held with MDHHS
Specialist, MDHHS Supervisor, and Foster Care Worker. There is
no finding.
Video Reviewed:
• Video footage from 01/09/2024 at approximately 8:00 pm
was reviewed on 01/12/2024 (Note: there is no audio). The
video starts outside the bedrooms with Staff 1 and Staff 2
standing. Youth A kicks the trash can, punches the wall,
and hits his head twice against the metal box on the wall.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 put Youth A in a two-person standing
restraint. Youth A drops down to his knees and Staff 1 and
Staff 2 release the hold. Youth A sits on the floor, rocks
back and forth and hits his head on the wall. Staff 1 and
Staff 2 attempt to help Youth A get off the floor, Youth A
kicks Staff 1, Staff 1 blocks the kick, grabs Youth A’s foot
and pushes his foot away. Staff 1 and Staff 2 move away
as Youth A sits on the floor and starts to rock back and
forth.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 01/09/2024 at approximately 6:45 pm
completed by Staff 3. Youth A and Youth B got into a
physical altercation because Youth B tried to take Youth
A’s toy. Staff 3 separated Youth A and Youth B and notified
Staff 4 of the incident.
• Incident report dated 01/09/2024 at approximately 8:00 pm
completed by Staff 1. Youth A was triggered because he
didn’t like the gift he received. Youth A was hitting himself
with his fists and hitting his head against the wall. Youth A
was restrained by Staff 1 and Staff 2.
• Medical exam for Youth A, completed by Nurse on
01/13/2024. Youth A has a small size bruise on his lower
chest. Youth A reported the bruise is from another youth
punching him in the chest.
• Facility Restraint Policy. Crisis Prevention Institute-
Nonviolent Crisis Intervention The staff approach is to apply
nonviolent physical crisis intervention, which is a safe, non-
harmful control and restraint position to safely control a
4

young person until he can regain control of his behavior.
This is only used as a last resort, after verbal interventions
have been attempted, and the young person presents a
danger to self or others.
• Staff 1 and Staff 2 have no disciplinary action.
Analysis The facility is compliant with the rule as video footage,
documentation, and interviews with staff and youths confirm the
restraint was in response to severely aggressive behavior that put
Youth A at risk of harm. Youth A reported the bruise on his chest
was from getting into a fight with Youth B.
Technical Assistance:
Provided technical assistance regarding ensuring staff move away
from a youth when they are kicking to avoid grabbing or touching
the youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.

sir_summary.summary: A special investigation was initiated after a youth was reported to have bruises from a restraint. The investigation found that staff used a brief physical restraint on a youth who was harming himself during a behavioral escalation after an event. Video evidence, interviews, and documentation confirmed the restraint was a last-resort response to prevent self-injury, aligning with emergency protocols, and the youth's bruise was attributed to a separate fight with another youth. The facility was found in compliance with rules, and no policy violations were substantiated, effectively clearing the staff and facility of culpability for the alleged improper restraint.
